blocks.name: csqrt
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include square root of a complex number.
blocks.origin: const class csqrt { sqrt }

blocks.name: diff.csqrt.s
diff.csqrt.c
diff.csqrt.w
cabs
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include a function for the absolute value (modulus) of a complex number.
blocks.origin: const class cabs { abs }

blocks.name: diff.cabs.s
diff.cabs.c
diff.cabs.w
df-sqrt
blocks.content: Define a function whose value is the square root of a complex number. For example, ` ( sqrt `` 2 5 ) = 5 ` ( ~ ex-sqrt ). Since ` ( y ^ 2 ) = x ` iff ` ( -u y ^ 2 ) = x ` , we ensure uniqueness by restricting the range to numbers with positive real part, or numbers with 0 real part and nonnegative imaginary part. A description can be found under "Principal square root of a complex number" at ~ http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Square_root . The square root symbol was introduced in 1525 by Christoff Rudolff. See ~ sqrtcl for its closure, ~ sqrtval for its value, ~ sqrtth and ~ sqsqrti for its relationship to squares, and ~ sqrt11i for uniqueness. (Contributed by NM, 27-Jul-1999.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 8-Jul-2013.)

blocks.name: df-abs
blocks.content: Define the function for the absolute value (modulus) of a complex number. See ~ abscli for its closure and ~ absval or ~ absval2i for its value. For example, ` ( abs `` -u 2 ) = 2 ` ( ~ ex-abs ). (Contributed by NM, 27-Jul-1999.)

blocks.name: sqrtval
blocks.content: Value of square root function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Jul-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm sqrtval(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(csqrt, c0), crio(s0, cc, w3a(wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(s0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(s0)), crp)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cc, csqrt, crio(s0, cc, w3a(wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(s0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(s0)), crp))), crio(s0, cc, w3a(wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cv(hs0)), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(s0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(s0)), crp))))
  riotabidv(s0, cc, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), w3a(wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cv(hs0)), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(s0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(s0)), crp)), w3a(wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(s0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(s0)), crp)))
  3anbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cv(hs0)), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(s0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(s0)), crp), wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0))
  eqeq2(cv(hs0), c0, co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2))
  df-sqrt(hs0, s0)
  riotaex(s0, cc, w3a(wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(s0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(s0)), crp)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(crio(s0, cc, w3a(wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(s0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(s0)), crp))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sqrtval(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℂ →(sqrt ` c0)= iota(s0 ∈ ℂ,((s0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` s0)∧(i[×]s0)∉ ℝ+)))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cc, csqrt, iota(s0 ∈ ℂ,((s0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` s0)∧(i[×]s0)∉ ℝ+)), iota(s0 ∈ ℂ,((s0[^]2)= hs0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` s0)∧(i[×]s0)∉ ℝ+)))
  riotabidv(s0, cc, hs0 = c0, ((s0[^]2)= hs0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` s0)∧(i[×]s0)∉ ℝ+), ((s0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` s0)∧(i[×]s0)∉ ℝ+))
  3anbi1d(hs0 = c0, (s0[^]2)= hs0, 0[≤](Re ` s0), (i[×]s0)∉ ℝ+, (s0[^]2)= c0)
  eqeq2(hs0, c0, (s0[^]2))
  df-sqrt(hs0, s0)
  riotaex(s0, cc, ((s0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` s0)∧(i[×]s0)∉ ℝ+))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(iota(s0 ∈ ℂ,((s0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` s0)∧(i[×]s0)∉ ℝ+)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: absval
blocks.content: The absolute value (modulus) of a complex number. Proposition 10-3.7(a) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 27-Jul-1999.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm absval(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), cfv(csqrt, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)))))
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cc, cabs, cfv(csqrt, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0))), cfv(csqrt, co(cv(hs0), cmul, cfv(ccj, cv(hs0)))))
  fveq2d(csqrt, co(cv(hs0), cmul, cfv(ccj, cv(hs0))), co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  mpdan(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cmul, cfv(ccj, cv(hs0))), co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0))), wceq(cfv(ccj, cv(hs0)), cfv(ccj, c0)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, ccj)
  oveq12(cv(hs0), c0, cfv(ccj, cv(hs0)), cfv(ccj, c0), cmul)
  df-abs(hs0)
  fvex(csqrt, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(csqrt, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0))))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm absval(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℂ →(abs ` c0)=(sqrt `(c0[×](* ` c0))))
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cc, cabs, (sqrt `(c0[×](* ` c0))), (sqrt `(hs0[×](* ` hs0))))
  fveq2d(csqrt, (hs0[×](* ` hs0)), (c0[×](* ` c0)), hs0 = c0)
  mpdan(hs0 = c0, (hs0[×](* ` hs0))=(c0[×](* ` c0)), (* ` hs0)=(* ` c0))
  fveq2(hs0, c0, ccj)
  oveq12(hs0, c0, (* ` hs0), (* ` c0), cmul)
  df-abs(hs0)
  fvex(csqrt, (c0[×](* ` c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c((sqrt `(c0[×](* ` c0))))
}

blocks.name: rennim
blocks.content: A real number does not lie on the negative imaginary axis. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Jul-2013.)
blocks.origin:

  syl(wcel(c0, cr), wi(wcel(co(ci, cmul, c0), crp), wceq(cfv(cre, co(ci, cmul, c0)), co(ci, cmul, c0))), wcel(co(ci, cmul, c0), cc))

  rpre(co(ci, cmul, c0))
  rereb(co(ci, cmul, c0))
  eqeq1d(cfv(cre, co(ci, cmul, c0)), co(ci, cmul, c0), nat0, wcel(c0, cr))
  eqtr3d(cfv(cre, co(ci, cmul, c0)), nat0, cfv(cre, co(nat0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c0))), wcel(c0, cr))
  fveq2d(cre, co(nat0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c0)), co(ci, cmul, c0), wcel(c0, cr))
  addid2d(co(ci, cmul, c0), wcel(c0, cr))

  ax-icn()
  recn(c0)

  mpan(wcel(c0, cr), wceq(cfv(cre, co(nat0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c0))), nat0), wcel(nat0, cr))

  rpne0(co(ci, cmul, c0))
  df-nel(co(ci, cmul, c0), crp)
}

blocks.name: 01sqrex
blocks.content: Existence of a square root for reals in the interval ` ( 0 , 1 ] ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jul-2013.)

blocks.name: resqreu
blocks.content: Existence and uniqueness for the real square root function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jul-2013.)

thm resqreu(setvar s0, class c0) {

  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c0)), wrex(s0, cc, w3a(wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(s0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(s0)), crp))), wrex(s0, cr, wa(wbr(nat0, cle, cv(s0)), wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0))))
  resqrex(s0, c0)
  reximi2(s0, cr, cc, wa(wbr(nat0, cle, cv(s0)), wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0)), w3a(wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(s0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(s0)), crp)))
  jca(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cr), wa(wbr(nat0, cle, cv(s0)), wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0))), wcel(cv(s0), cc), w3a(wceq(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(s0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(s0)), crp)))

blocks.name: resqrtcl
blocks.content: Closure of the square root function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jul-2013.)

  3syl(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cr), wa(wbr(nat0, cle, cv(hs0)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2), c0))), wceq(cfv(csqrt, c0), crio(hs1, cc, w3a(wceq(co(cv(hs1), cexp, nat2), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(hs1))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(hs1)), crp)))), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c0, cc))

  3anbi123d(wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(csqrt, c0)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(hs0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(hs0)), crp), wceq(co(cfv(csqrt, c0), cexp, nat2), c0), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cfv(csqrt, c0))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cfv(csqrt, c0)), crp))

  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 0[≤]c0)→(((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re `(sqrt ` c0))∧(i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+))
} = {
  mpbird((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 0[≤]c0), (((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re `(sqrt ` c0))∧(i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+), iota(hs0 ∈ ℂ,((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+))=(sqrt ` c0))
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℝ, 0[≤]c0, iota(hs0 ∈ ℂ,((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+))=(sqrt ` c0))
  syl(c0 ∈ ℝ, iota(hs0 ∈ ℂ,((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+))=(sqrt ` c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  recn(c0)
  eqcomd(iota(hs0 ∈ ℂ,((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+)), (sqrt ` c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  sqrtval(hs0, c0)
  syl2anc((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 0[≤]c0), ((((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re `(sqrt ` c0))∧(i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+)↔ iota(hs0 ∈ ℂ,((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+))=(sqrt ` c0)), (sqrt ` c0)∈ ℂ, ∃!(hs0 ∈ ℂ,((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+)))
  recnd((sqrt ` c0), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 0[≤]c0))
  resqrtcl(c0)
  resqreu(hs0, c0)
  riota2(hs0, (sqrt ` c0), cc, ((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+), (((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re `(sqrt ` c0))∧(i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+))
  3anbi123d(hs0 =(sqrt ` c0), (hs0[^]2)= c0, 0[≤](Re ` hs0), (i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+, ((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0, 0[≤](Re `(sqrt ` c0)), (i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+)
  eqeq1d((hs0[^]2), c0, ((sqrt ` c0)[^]2), hs0 =(sqrt ` c0))
  oveq1(hs0, (sqrt ` c0), cexp, nat2)
  breq2d(nat0, cle, (Re ` hs0), (Re `(sqrt ` c0)), hs0 =(sqrt ` c0))
  fveq2(hs0, (sqrt ` c0), cre)
  syl(hs0 =(sqrt ` c0), ((i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+ ↔(i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+), (i[×]hs0)=(i[×](sqrt ` c0)))
  oveq2(hs0, (sqrt ` c0), ci, cmul)
  neleq1((i[×]hs0), (i[×](sqrt ` c0)), crp)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c((sqrt ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.w((((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re `(sqrt ` c0))∧(i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+))

blocks.name: resqrtth
blocks.content: Square root theorem over the reals. Theorem I.35 of [Apostol] p. 29. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jul-2013.)

blocks.name: remsqsqrt
blocks.content: Square of square root. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jul-2013.)

blocks.name: sqrtge0
blocks.content: The square root function is nonnegative for nonnegative input. (Contributed by NM, 26-May-1999.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jul-2013.)

blocks.name: sqrtgt0
blocks.content: The square root function is positive for positive input. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jul-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Sep-2013.)

  mulge0d(cfv(csqrt, c0), cfv(csqrt, c1), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c1))))

blocks.name: sqrtle
blocks.content: Square root is monotonic. (Contributed by NM, 17-Mar-2005.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm sqrtle(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c1))), wb(wbr(c0, cle, c1), wbr(cfv(csqrt, c0), cle, cfv(csqrt, c1))))
} = {
  bitr2d(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c1))), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wbr(cfv(csqrt, c0), cle, cfv(csqrt, c1)), wbr(co(cfv(csqrt, c0), cexp, nat2), cle, co(cfv(csqrt, c1), cexp, nat2)))
  syl2an(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c1)), wb(wbr(cfv(csqrt, c0), cle, cfv(csqrt, c1)), wbr(co(cfv(csqrt, c0), cexp, nat2), cle, co(cfv(csqrt, c1), cexp, nat2))), wa(wcel(cfv(csqrt, c0), cr), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(csqrt, c0))), wa(wcel(cfv(csqrt, c1), cr), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(csqrt, c1))))
  jca(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c0)), wcel(cfv(csqrt, c0), cr), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(csqrt, c0)))
  resqrtcl(c0)
  sqrtge0(c0)
  jca(wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c1)), wcel(cfv(csqrt, c1), cr), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(csqrt, c1)))
  resqrtcl(c1)
  sqrtge0(c1)
  le2sq(cfv(csqrt, c0), cfv(csqrt, c1))
  breqan12d(co(cfv(csqrt, c0), cexp, nat2), cle, co(cfv(csqrt, c1), cexp, nat2), c0, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c1)))
  resqrtth(c0)
  resqrtth(c1)
}

thm sqrtle(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 0[≤]c0)∧(c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ 0[≤]c1))→(c0[≤]c1 ↔(sqrt ` c0)[≤](sqrt ` c1)))
} = {

blocks.name: sqrt00

blocks.name: sqrtm1
blocks.content: The imaginary unit is the square root of negative 1. A lot of people like to call this the "definition" of ` _i ` , but the definition of ` sqrt ` ~ df-sqrt has already been crafted with ` _i ` being mentioned explicitly, and in any case it doesn't make too much sense to define a value based on a function evaluated outside its domain. A more appropriate view is to take ~ ax-i2m1 or ~ i2 as the "definition", and simply postulate the existence of a number satisfying this property. This is the approach we take here. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jul-2013.)

  muladd(c0, c1, cfv(ccj, c0), cfv(ccj, c1))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, c1)), cexp, nat2), co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmul, cfv(ccj, co(c0, caddc, c1)))), wcel(co(c0, caddc, c1), cc))
  addcl(c0, c1)
  absvalsq(co(c0, caddc, c1))
  oveq12d(co(co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(cabs, c1), cexp, nat2)), caddc, co(nat2, cmul, cfv(cre, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)))), co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c1), cmul, c1)), co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  oveqan12d(co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(cabs, c1), cexp, nat2), co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)), co(cfv(ccj, c1), cmul, c1), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  absvalsq(c0)
  eqtrd(co(cfv(cabs, c1), cexp, nat2), co(cfv(ccj, c1), cmul, c1), co(c1, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), wcel(c1, cc))
  absvalsq(c1)
  mpdan(wcel(c1, cc), wceq(co(c1, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), co(cfv(ccj, c1), cmul, c1)), wcel(cfv(ccj, c1), cc))
  mulcom(c1, cfv(ccj, c1))
  eqtr3d(co(nat2, cmul, cfv(cre, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)))), co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, c1)), co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  addcjd(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wcel(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), cc), wcel(cfv(ccj, c1), cc))
  mulcl(c0, cfv(ccj, c1))
  oveq2d(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1))), co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  eqtrd(cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1))), co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, c1), co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, cfv(ccj, cfv(ccj, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wceq(cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1))), co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, cfv(ccj, cfv(ccj, c1)))), wcel(cfv(ccj, c1), cc))
  cjcl(c1)
  cjmul(c0, cfv(ccj, c1))
  oveq2d(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, cfv(ccj, cfv(ccj, c1)), c1, wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wceq(cfv(ccj, cfv(ccj, c1)), c1))
  cjcj(c1)
}

blocks.name: sqabssub
blocks.content: Square of absolute value of difference. (Contributed by NM, 21-Jan-2007.)
blocks.origin:
thm sqabssub(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, cmin, c1)), cexp, nat2), co(co(co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(cabs, c1), cexp, nat2)), cmin, co(nat2, cmul, cfv(cre, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)))))))
} = {
  3eqtr4d(co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, cmin, c1)), cexp, nat2), co(co(co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(cabs, c1), cexp, nat2)), cmin, co(nat2, cmul, cfv(cre, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1))))), co(co(c0, cmin, c1), cmul, cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmin, c1))), co(co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c1), cmul, c1)), cmin, co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  eqtrd(co(co(c0, cmin, c1), cmul, cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmin, c1))), co(co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c1), cmul, c1)), cmin, co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, c1))), co(co(c0, cmin, c1), cmul, co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmin, cfv(ccj, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  oveq2d(co(c0, cmin, c1), cmul, cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmin, c1)), co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmin, cfv(ccj, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  cjsub(c0, c1)
  mpdan(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmin, c1), cmul, co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmin, cfv(ccj, c1))), co(co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c1), cmul, c1)), cmin, co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, c1)))), wa(wcel(cfv(ccj, c0), cc), wcel(cfv(ccj, c1), cc)))
  anim12i(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wcel(cfv(ccj, c0), cc), wcel(cfv(ccj, c1), cc))
  cjcl(c0)
  mulsub(c0, c1, cfv(ccj, c0), cfv(ccj, c1))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, cmin, c1)), cexp, nat2), co(co(c0, cmin, c1), cmul, cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmin, c1)))), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c1), cc))
  subcl(c0, c1)
  absvalsq(co(c0, cmin, c1))
  oveq12d(co(co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(cabs, c1), cexp, nat2)), cmin, co(nat2, cmul, cfv(cre, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)))), co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c1), cmul, c1)), co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  oveqan12d(co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(cabs, c1), cexp, nat2), co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)), co(cfv(ccj, c1), cmul, c1), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  absvalsq(c0)
  eqtrd(co(cfv(cabs, c1), cexp, nat2), co(cfv(ccj, c1), cmul, c1), co(c1, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), wcel(c1, cc))
  absvalsq(c1)
  mpdan(wcel(c1, cc), wceq(co(c1, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), co(cfv(ccj, c1), cmul, c1)), wcel(cfv(ccj, c1), cc))
  mulcom(c1, cfv(ccj, c1))
  eqtr3d(co(nat2, cmul, cfv(cre, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)))), co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), caddc, co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, c1)), co(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  addcjd(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wcel(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), cc), wcel(cfv(ccj, c1), cc))
  mulcl(c0, cfv(ccj, c1))
  oveq2d(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1)), caddc, cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1))), co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  eqtrd(cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1))), co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, c1), co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, cfv(ccj, cfv(ccj, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wceq(cfv(ccj, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c1))), co(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, cfv(ccj, cfv(ccj, c1)))), wcel(cfv(ccj, c1), cc))
  cjcl(c1)
  cjmul(c0, cfv(ccj, c1))
  oveq2d(cfv(ccj, c0), cmul, cfv(ccj, cfv(ccj, c1)), c1, wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc), wceq(cfv(ccj, cfv(ccj, c1)), c1))
  cjcj(c1)
}

blocks.name: absval2
blocks.content: Value of absolute value function. Definition 10.36 of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 17-Mar-2005.)

blocks.name: abs0
blocks.content: The absolute value of 0. (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absi
blocks.content: The absolute value of the imaginary unit. (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-2005.)
blocks.origin:
thm absi() {
  |- wceq(cfv(cabs, ci), nat1)
} = {
  3eqtri(cfv(cabs, ci), nat1, cfv(csqrt, co(ci, cmul, cfv(ccj, ci))), cfv(csqrt, nat1))
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(cabs, ci), cfv(csqrt, co(ci, cmul, cfv(ccj, ci)))), wcel(ci, cc))
  absval(ci)
  fveq2i(csqrt, co(ci, cmul, cfv(ccj, ci)), nat1)
  3eqtri(co(ci, cmul, cfv(ccj, ci)), nat1, co(ci, cmul, cneg(ci)), cneg(co(ci, cmul, ci)))
  oveq2i(ci, cmul, cfv(ccj, ci), cneg(ci))
  cji()
  mulneg2i(ci, ci)
  ax-icn()
  eqtri(cneg(co(ci, cmul, ci)), nat1, cneg(cneg(nat1)))
  negeqi(co(ci, cmul, ci), cneg(nat1))
  ixi()
  negneg1e1()
  sqrt1()
}
blocks.pretty:
thm absi() {
  ⊢ (abs ` i)= 1
} = {
  3eqtri((abs ` i), nat1, (sqrt `(i[×](* ` i))), (sqrt ` 1))
  ax-mp((abs ` i)=(sqrt `(i[×](* ` i))), i ∈ ℂ)
  absval(ci)
  fveq2i(csqrt, (i[×](* ` i)), nat1)
  3eqtri((i[×](* ` i)), nat1, (i[×]-u(i)), -u((i[×]i)))
  oveq2i(ci, cmul, (* ` i), -u(i))
  cji()
  mulneg2i(ci, ci)
  ax-icn()
  eqtri(-u((i[×]i)), nat1, -u(-u(1)))
  negeqi((i[×]i), -u(1))
  ixi()
  negneg1e1()
  sqrt1()
}

blocks.name: absge0
blocks.content: Absolute value is nonnegative. (Contributed by NM, 20-Nov-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absrpcl
blocks.content: The absolute value of a nonzero number is a positive real. (Contributed by FL, 27-Dec-2007.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm absrpcl(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), crp))
} = {
  eqeltrd(cfv(cabs, c0), crp, cfv(csqrt, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), cfv(csqrt, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)))))
  absval(c0)
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(cfv(csqrt, co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0))), crp), wcel(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)), crp))
  elrpd(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  ne0gt0d(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  cjmulrcld(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  cjmulge0d(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  mulne0d(c0, cfv(ccj, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  cjcld(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  cjne0d(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0))
  rpsqrtcl(co(c0, cmul, cfv(ccj, c0)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm absrpcl(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0)→(abs ` c0)∈ ℝ+)
} = {
  eqeltrd((abs ` c0), crp, (sqrt `(c0[×](* ` c0))), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0, (abs ` c0)=(sqrt `(c0[×](* ` c0))))
  absval(c0)
  syl((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0), (sqrt `(c0[×](* ` c0)))∈ ℝ+, (c0[×](* ` c0))∈ ℝ+)
  elrpd((c0[×](* ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  ne0gt0d((c0[×](* ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  cjmulrcld(c0, (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  cjmulge0d(c0, (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  mulne0d(c0, (* ` c0), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  cjcld(c0, (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  cjne0d(c0, (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  simpl(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0)
  simpr(c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0)
  rpsqrtcl((c0[×](* ` c0)))
}

blocks.name: abs00
blocks.content: The absolute value of a number is zero iff the number is zero. Proposition 10-3.7(c) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 26-Sep-2005.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: abs00ad
blocks.content: A complex number is zero iff its absolute value is zero. Deduction form of ~ abs00 . (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)

blocks.name: abs00bd
blocks.content: If a complex number is zero, its absolute value is zero. Converse of ~ abs00d . One-way deduction form of ~ abs00 . (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)

blocks.name: absreimsq
blocks.content: Square of the absolute value of a number that has been decomposed into real and imaginary parts. (Contributed by NM, 1-Feb-2007.)
blocks.origin:
thm absreimsq(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wceq(co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2), co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c1, cexp, nat2))))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2), co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c1, cexp, nat2)), co(co(cfv(cre, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(cim, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wceq(co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2), co(co(cfv(cre, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(cim, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2))), wcel(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cc))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cc), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(co(ci, cmul, c1), cc))
  recn(c0)
  sylancr(wcel(c1, cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, c1), cc), wcel(ci, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  ax-icn()
  recn(c1)
  mulcl(ci, c1)
  addcl(c0, co(ci, cmul, c1))
  absvalsq2(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))
  oveq12d(co(cfv(cre, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(cfv(cim, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2), co(c0, cexp, nat2), co(c1, cexp, nat2), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  oveq1d(cfv(cre, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2, c0, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  crre(c0, c1)
  oveq1d(cfv(cim, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  crim(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: absreim
blocks.content: Absolute value of a number that has been decomposed into real and imaginary parts. (Contributed by NM, 14-Jan-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm absreim(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wceq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cfv(csqrt, co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c1, cexp, nat2)))))
} = {
  eqtr3d(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cfv(csqrt, co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c1, cexp, nat2))), cfv(csqrt, co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wceq(cfv(csqrt, co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2)), cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cr), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cr), wcel(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cc))
  abscl(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))), wcel(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cc))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)), cc), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(co(ci, cmul, c1), cc))
  recn(c0)
  sylancr(wcel(c1, cr), wcel(co(ci, cmul, c1), cc), wcel(ci, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  ax-icn()
  recn(c1)
  mulcl(ci, c1)
  addcl(c0, co(ci, cmul, c1))
  absge0(co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1)))
  sqrtsq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))))
  fveq2d(csqrt, co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, caddc, co(ci, cmul, c1))), cexp, nat2), co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c1, cexp, nat2)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  absreimsq(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: absmul
blocks.content: Absolute value distributes over multiplication. Proposition 10-3.7(f) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 11-Oct-1999.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm absmul(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, cmul, c1)), co(cfv(cabs, c0), cmul, cfv(cabs, c1))))
} = {

blocks.name: absimle
blocks.content: The absolute value of a complex number is greater than or equal to the absolute value of its imaginary part. (Contributed by NM, 17-Mar-2005.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm absimle(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wbr(cfv(cabs, cfv(cim, c0)), cle, cfv(cabs, c0)))

  mulcld(cneg(ci), c0, wcel(c0, cc))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cneg(ci), cc))
  id(wcel(c0, cc))
  absrele(co(cneg(ci), cmul, c0))

  imre(c0)
  eqtr2d(cfv(cabs, c0), cfv(cabs, co(cneg(ci), cmul, c0)), co(cfv(cabs, cneg(ci)), cmul, cfv(cabs, c0)), wcel(c0, cc))
  mpan(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cabs, co(cneg(ci), cmul, c0)), co(cfv(cabs, cneg(ci)), cmul, cfv(cabs, c0))), wcel(cneg(ci), cc))
  negicn()
  absmul(cneg(ci), c0)
  syl5eq(co(cfv(cabs, cneg(ci)), cmul, cfv(cabs, c0)), cfv(cabs, c0), co(nat1, cmul, cfv(cabs, c0)), wcel(c0, cc))
  oveq1i(cfv(cabs, cneg(ci)), cmul, cfv(cabs, c0), nat1)
  eqtri(cfv(cabs, cneg(ci)), nat1, cfv(cabs, ci))
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(cabs, cneg(ci)), cfv(cabs, ci)), wcel(ci, cc))

  absneg(ci)

blocks.name: absz
blocks.content: A real number is an integer iff its absolute value is an integer. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

thm absz(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cr), wb(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), cz)))

  eleq1(cfv(cabs, c0), c0, cz)
  syl5ibrcom(wcel(c0, cr), wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), cneg(c0)), wb(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), cz)), wb(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cneg(c0), cz)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cr), wb(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cneg(c0), cz)), wcel(c0, cc))
  recn(c0)
  znegclb(c0)
  bibi2d(wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), cneg(c0)), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), cz), wcel(cneg(c0), cz))
  eleq1(cfv(cabs, c0), cneg(c0), cz)
  absor(c0)
}

  recnd(c0, ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[<]c1))

  adantr(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, ((abs ` c0)= c0 ∨(abs ` c0)= -u(c0)))
  absor(c0)
  ancomsd(((abs ` c0)= c0 ∨(abs ` c0)= -u(c0)), -u(c0)[<]c1, c0[<]c1, (abs ` c0)[<]c1)
  jaoa((abs ` c0)= c0, (abs ` c0)= -u(c0), c0[<]c1, -u(c0)[<]c1, (abs ` c0)[<]c1)
  biimprd((abs ` c0)= c0, c0[<]c1, (abs ` c0)[<]c1)
  breq1((abs ` c0), c0, clt, c1)
  biimprd((abs ` c0)= -u(c0), -u(c0)[<]c1, (abs ` c0)[<]c1)
  breq1((abs ` c0), -u(c0), clt, c1)
  anbi1d((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), -u(c0)[<]c1, c0[<]c1, -u(c1)[<]c0)
  ltnegcon1(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: absle
blocks.content: Absolute value and 'less than or equal to' relation. (Contributed by NM, 6-Apr-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

thm absle(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wb(wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1), wa(wbr(cneg(c1), cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c1))))
} = {
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1), wa(wbr(cneg(c1), cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wa(wbr(cneg(c0), cle, c1), wbr(c0, cle, c1)))
  impbid(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1), wa(wbr(cneg(c0), cle, c1), wbr(c0, cle, c1)))

  letrd(cneg(c0), c1, cfv(cabs, c0), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1)))
  breqtrd(cneg(c0), cle, cfv(cabs, c0), cfv(cabs, cneg(c0)), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1)))
  syl(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1)), wbr(cneg(c0), cle, cfv(cabs, cneg(c0))), wcel(cneg(c0), cr))
  renegcld(c0, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1)))

  absneg(c0)

  ad2antrr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1), wbr(c0, cle, cfv(cabs, c0)))
  leabs(c0)
  simpr(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wi(wa(wbr(cneg(c0), cle, c1), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1)), wo(wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), c0), wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), cneg(c0))))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wo(wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), c0), wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), cneg(c0))))
  absor(c0)
  ancomsd(wo(wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), c0), wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), cneg(c0))), wbr(cneg(c0), cle, c1), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1))
  jaoa(wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), c0), wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), cneg(c0)), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wbr(cneg(c0), cle, c1), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1))
  biimprd(wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), c0), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1))
  breq1(cfv(cabs, c0), c0, cle, c1)
  biimprd(wceq(cfv(cabs, c0), cneg(c0)), wbr(cneg(c0), cle, c1), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), cle, c1))
  breq1(cfv(cabs, c0), cneg(c0), cle, c1)
  anbi1d(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cneg(c0), cle, c1), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wbr(cneg(c1), cle, c0))
  lenegcon1(c0, c1)

thm absle(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)→((abs ` c0)[≤]c1 ↔(-u(c1)[≤]c0 ∧ c0[≤]c1)))
} = {
  bitrd((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), (abs ` c0)[≤]c1, (-u(c1)[≤]c0 ∧ c0[≤]c1), (-u(c0)[≤]c1 ∧ c0[≤]c1))
  impbid((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), (abs ` c0)[≤]c1, (-u(c0)[≤]c1 ∧ c0[≤]c1))
  ex((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), (abs ` c0)[≤]c1, (-u(c0)[≤]c1 ∧ c0[≤]c1))
  jca(((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[≤]c1), -u(c0)[≤]c1, c0[≤]c1)
  letrd(-u(c0), c1, (abs ` c0), ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[≤]c1))
  breqtrd(-u(c0), cle, (abs ` c0), (abs ` -u(c0)), ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[≤]c1))
  syl(((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[≤]c1), -u(c0)[≤](abs ` -u(c0)), -u(c0)∈ ℝ)
  renegcld(c0, ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[≤]c1))
  leabs(-u(c0))
  syl(((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[≤]c1), (abs ` -u(c0))=(abs ` c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  absneg(c0)
  letrd(c0, c1, (abs ` c0), ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[≤]c1))
  syl(((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[≤]c1), (abs ` c0)∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℂ)
  recnd(c0, ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[≤]c1))
  simpll(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, (abs ` c0)[≤]c1)
  abscl(c0)
  simplr(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, (abs ` c0)[≤]c1)
  ad2antrr(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, (abs ` c0)[≤]c1, c0[≤](abs ` c0))
  leabs(c0)
  simpr((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), (abs ` c0)[≤]c1)
  syl((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), ((-u(c0)[≤]c1 ∧ c0[≤]c1)→(abs ` c0)[≤]c1), ((abs ` c0)= c0 ∨(abs ` c0)= -u(c0)))
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, ((abs ` c0)= c0 ∨(abs ` c0)= -u(c0)))
  absor(c0)
  ancomsd(((abs ` c0)= c0 ∨(abs ` c0)= -u(c0)), -u(c0)[≤]c1, c0[≤]c1, (abs ` c0)[≤]c1)
  jaoa((abs ` c0)= c0, (abs ` c0)= -u(c0), c0[≤]c1, -u(c0)[≤]c1, (abs ` c0)[≤]c1)
  biimprd((abs ` c0)= c0, c0[≤]c1, (abs ` c0)[≤]c1)
  breq1((abs ` c0), c0, cle, c1)
  biimprd((abs ` c0)= -u(c0), -u(c0)[≤]c1, (abs ` c0)[≤]c1)
  breq1((abs ` c0), -u(c0), cle, c1)
  anbi1d((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), -u(c0)[≤]c1, c0[≤]c1, -u(c1)[≤]c0)
  lenegcon1(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: abssubne0
blocks.content: If the absolute value of a complex number is less than a real, its difference from the real is nonzero. (Contributed by NM, 2-Nov-2007.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm abssubne0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1)), wne(co(c1, cmin, c0), nat0))
} = {
  3impa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1), wne(co(c1, cmin, c0), nat0))
  subne0d(c1, c0, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1)))
  syl(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1)), wne(c1, c0), wne(cfv(cabs, c1), cfv(cabs, c0)))
  gtned(cfv(cabs, c1), cfv(cabs, c0), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1)))
  ltletrd(cfv(cabs, c0), cfv(cabs, c1), c1, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1)))
  syl(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1)), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), cr), wcel(c0, cc))
  simpll(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1))
  abscl(c0)
  syl(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1)), wcel(cfv(cabs, c1), cr), wcel(c1, cc))
  recnd(c1, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1)))
  abscl(c1)
  simpr(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1))
  syl(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1)), wbr(c1, cle, cfv(cabs, c1)), wcel(c1, cr))
  simplr(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cfv(cabs, c0), clt, c1))
  leabs(c1)
  necon3i(cfv(cabs, c1), cfv(cabs, c0), c1, c0)
  fveq2(c1, c0, cabs)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm abssubne0(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧(abs ` c0)[<]c1)→(c1[-]c0)≠ 0)
} = {
  3impa(c0 ∈ ℂ, c1 ∈ ℝ, (abs ` c0)[<]c1, (c1[-]c0)≠ 0)
  subne0d(c1, c0, ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[<]c1))
  syl(((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[<]c1), c1 ≠ c0, (abs ` c1)≠(abs ` c0))
  gtned((abs ` c1), (abs ` c0), ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[<]c1))
  ltletrd((abs ` c0), (abs ` c1), c1, ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[<]c1))
  syl(((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[<]c1), (abs ` c0)∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℂ)
  simpll(c0 ∈ ℂ, c1 ∈ ℝ, (abs ` c0)[<]c1)
  abscl(c0)
  syl(((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[<]c1), (abs ` c1)∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℂ)
  recnd(c1, ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[<]c1))
  abscl(c1)
  simpr((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), (abs ` c0)[<]c1)
  syl(((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)∧(abs ` c0)[<]c1), c1[≤](abs ` c1), c1 ∈ ℝ)
  simplr(c0 ∈ ℂ, c1 ∈ ℝ, (abs ` c0)[<]c1)
  leabs(c1)
  necon3i((abs ` c1), (abs ` c0), c1, c0)
  fveq2(c1, c0, cabs)
}

thm absdiflt(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wb(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, cmin, c1)), clt, c2), wa(wbr(co(c1, cmin, c2), clt, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(c1, caddc, c2)))))

  bitrd(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, cmin, c1)), clt, c2), wa(wbr(co(c1, cmin, c2), clt, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(c1, caddc, c2))), wa(wbr(cneg(c2), clt, co(c0, cmin, c1)), wbr(co(c0, cmin, c1), clt, c2)))
  stoic3(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wb(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, cmin, c1)), clt, c2), wa(wbr(cneg(c2), clt, co(c0, cmin, c1)), wbr(co(c0, cmin, c1), clt, c2))), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c1), cr))
  resubcl(c0, c1)
  abslt(co(c0, cmin, c1), c2)
  anbi12d(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wbr(cneg(c2), clt, co(c0, cmin, c1)), wbr(co(c0, cmin, c1), clt, c2), wbr(co(c1, cmin, c2), clt, c0), wbr(c0, clt, co(c1, caddc, c2)))
  bitr3d(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wbr(cneg(c2), clt, co(c0, cmin, c1)), wbr(co(c1, cmin, c2), clt, c0), wbr(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c2)), clt, c0))
  3comr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wb(wbr(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c2)), clt, c0), wbr(cneg(c2), clt, co(c0, cmin, c1))))
  syl3an2(wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wcel(c0, cr), wb(wbr(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c2)), clt, c0), wbr(cneg(c2), clt, co(c0, cmin, c1))), wcel(cneg(c2), cr))
  renegcl(c2)
  ltaddsub2(c1, cneg(c2), c0)
  breq1d(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c2)), clt, c0, co(c1, cmin, c2), w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)))
  3adant1(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wceq(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c2)), co(c1, cmin, c2)))
  syl2an(wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wceq(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c2)), co(c1, cmin, c2)), wcel(c1, cc), wcel(c2, cc))
  recn(c1)
  recn(c2)
  negsub(c1, c2)

blocks.name: absdifle

blocks.origin:
thm absdifle(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wb(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, cmin, c1)), cle, c2), wa(wbr(co(c1, cmin, c2), cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, co(c1, caddc, c2)))))

  bitr3d(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wbr(cneg(c2), cle, co(c0, cmin, c1)), wbr(co(c1, cmin, c2), cle, c0), wbr(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c2)), cle, c0))
  3comr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wb(wbr(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c2)), cle, c0), wbr(cneg(c2), cle, co(c0, cmin, c1))))
  syl3an2(wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wcel(c0, cr), wb(wbr(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c2)), cle, c0), wbr(cneg(c2), cle, co(c0, cmin, c1))), wcel(cneg(c2), cr))
  renegcl(c2)

  3adant1(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wceq(co(c1, caddc, cneg(c2)), co(c1, cmin, c2)))

  recn(c2)

blocks.name: elicc4abs
blocks.content: Membership in a symmetric closed real interval. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 16-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm elicc4abs(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wb(wcel(c2, co(co(c0, cmin, c1), cicc, co(c0, caddc, c1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c2, cmin, c0)), cle, c1)))
} = {
  bitr4d(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)), wcel(c2, co(co(c0, cmin, c1), cicc, co(c0, caddc, c1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c2, cmin, c0)), cle, c1), wa(wbr(co(c0, cmin, c1), cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, co(c0, caddc, c1))))

  rexrd(co(c0, cmin, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wcel(co(c0, cmin, c1), cr))
  resubcl(c0, c1)
  rexrd(co(c0, caddc, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr)))

  readdcl(c0, c1)
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, cr), wcel(c2, cxr))

blocks.name: releabs

blocks.name: absidm
blocks.content: The absolute value function is idempotent. (Contributed by NM, 20-Nov-2004.)

blocks.name: absgt0
blocks.content: The absolute value of a nonzero number is positive. (Contributed by NM, 1-Oct-1999.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: nnabscl
blocks.content: The absolute value of a nonzero integer is a positive integer. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 21-Mar-2011.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-May-2011.)

blocks.name: abssub
blocks.content: Swapping order of subtraction doesn't change the absolute value. (Contributed by NM, 1-Oct-1999.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: abssubge0
blocks.content: Absolute value of a nonnegative difference. (Contributed by NM, 14-Feb-2008.)

blocks.name: abssuble0
blocks.content: Absolute value of a nonpositive difference. (Contributed by FL, 3-Jan-2008.)

blocks.name: rexuz3
blocks.content: Restrict the base of the upper integers set to another upper integers set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Dec-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm rexuz3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cz), wb(wrex(s0, c1, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cuz, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  syl6rbb(wcel(c0, cz), wrex(s0, c1, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wa(wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), c1))), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0))))
  biantrurd(wcel(c0, cz), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), c1))))
  mpan2(wcel(c0, cz), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), c1))), wral(s1, c1, wcel(cv(s1), c1)))
  ralel(s1, c1)
  rspcev(s0, c0, cz, wral(s1, c1, wcel(cv(s1), c1)), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), c1)))
  raleqdv(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), c1, wceq(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c1))
  syl6eqr(cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), c1, cfv(cuz, c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(s0), c0, cuz)
  bitr2i(wa(wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), c1))), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0))), wrex(s0, c1, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0))))
  rexbii2(s0, c1, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0)))
  impbii(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cz), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0))))
  imp(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s0), cz), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0))))
  jctild(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0), wcel(cv(s0), cz), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0)))
  ralimdva(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1), w0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0))
  ancrd(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)))), w0, wcel(cv(s1), c1))
  a1d(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)))), w0, wcel(cv(s1), c1))
  uztrn2(cv(s0), c1, cv(s1), c0)
  eleq2s(cv(s0), c1, cfv(cuz, c0), wcel(cv(s0), cz))
  eluzelz(cv(s0), c0)
  jca(wa(wcel(cv(s0), cz), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0))), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0))
  syl2an(wcel(cv(s0), cz), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), c1)))
  uzid(cv(s0))
  ralimi(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0), wcel(cv(s1), c1))
  simpl(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0)
  rspcva(s1, cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), c1), wcel(cv(s0), c1))
  eleq1w(s1, s0, c1)
  adantl(wcel(cv(s0), cz), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0)), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0))
  ralimi(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0), w0)
  simpr(wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0)
  rexanuz(s0, s1, wcel(cv(s1), c1), w0)
  diff.cz.s(s0)
  diff.wral.s(s0, s1, c1, wcel(cv(s1), c1))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cuz, cv(s0))
  diff.cuz.s(s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(s0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s1), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: rexanuz2
blocks.content: Combine two different upper integer properties into one. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Dec-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm rexanuz2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wb(wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(w0, w1))), wa(wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w1))))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cuz, c1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(w0, w1))), wa(wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w1))), wcel(c1, cz))
  rexlimiv(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(w0, w1)), wcel(c1, cz))
  a1d(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(w0, w1)), wcel(c1, cz))
  adantr(wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w1)), wcel(c1, cz))
  rexlimiv(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0), wcel(c1, cz))
  a1d(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0), wcel(c1, cz))
  eleq2s(cv(s0), c0, cfv(cuz, c1), wcel(c1, cz))
  eluzel2(cv(s0), c1)
  bitrd(wcel(c1, cz), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(w0, w1))), wa(wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w1))), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(w0, w1))))
  rexuz3(s0, s1, c1, c0, wa(w0, w1))
  syl6rbbr(wcel(c1, cz), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), wa(w0, w1))), wa(wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w1))), wa(wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w1))))
  anbi12d(wcel(c1, cz), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w1)), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, cz, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w1)))
  rexuz3(s0, s1, c1, c0, w0)
  rexuz3(s0, s1, c1, c0, w1)
  rexanuz(s0, s1, w0, w1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c1, cz)
  diff.cz.s(s0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, w0, w1)
}

blocks.name: r19.29uz
blocks.content: A version of ~ 19.29 for upper integer quantifiers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Feb-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm r19.29uz(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wa(wral(s0, c0, w0), wrex(s1, c0, wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), w1))), wrex(s1, c0, wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(w0, w1))))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cuz, c1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wral(s0, c0, w0), wrex(s1, c0, wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), w1))), wrex(s1, c0, wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(w0, w1)))), diffsc(s1, c1))
  imp(wral(s0, c0, w0), wrex(s1, c0, wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), w1)), wrex(s1, c0, wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(w0, w1))))
  reximdva(s1, c0, wral(s0, c0, w0), wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), w1), wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(w0, w1)))
  syl(wa(wral(s0, c0, w0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wi(wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), w1), wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wa(w0, w1))), wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wi(w1, wa(w0, w1))))
  impcom(wral(s0, c0, w0), wcel(cv(s1), c0), wral(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wi(w1, wa(w0, w1))))
  ralimdv2(s0, c0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s1), c0), w0, wi(w1, wa(w0, w1)))
  imim12d(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cv(s1))), wi(w1, wa(w0, w1)))
  ex(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  uztrn2(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0), c1)
  a1i(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wi(w0, wi(w1, wa(w0, w1))))
  pm3.2(w0, w1)
  ralim(s0, cfv(cuz, cv(s1)), w1, wa(w0, w1))
  diff.wral.s(s1, s0, c0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s1), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: r19.2uz
blocks.content: A version of ~ r19.2z for upper integer quantifiers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Feb-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm r19.2uz(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s1, c0, w0))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cuz, c1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s1, c0, w0)), diffsc(s0, c1))
  rexlimiva(s0, c0, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0), wrex(s1, c0, w0))
  syldan(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0), wrex(s1, c0, w0), wrex(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0))
  sylan(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0), wrex(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0), wne(cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), emptycls))
  eleq2s(cv(s0), c0, cfv(cuz, c1), wne(cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), emptycls))
  3syl(wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, c1)), wne(cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), emptycls), wcel(cv(s0), cz), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cv(s0))))
  eluzelz(cv(s0), c1)
  uzid(cv(s0))
  ne0i(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, cv(s0)))
  r19.2z(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)
  imp(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wrex(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0), wrex(s1, c0, w0))
  reximdv2(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), c0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0, w0)
  anim1d(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), w0, wcel(cv(s1), c0))
  ex(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s1), c0))
  uztrn2(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1), c1)
  diff.wrex.s(s0, s1, c0, w0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cuz, cv(s0))
  diff.cuz.s(s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(s0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm r19.2uz(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (∃(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0), w0))→ ∃(s1 ∈ c0, w0))
  ⊣ c0 =(ℤ≥ ` c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii((∃(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0), w0))→ ∃(s1 ∈ c0, w0)), d(s0, c1))
  rexlimiva(s0, c0, ∀(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0), w0), ∃(s1 ∈ c0, w0))
  syldan(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0), w0), ∃(s1 ∈ c0, w0), ∃(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0), w0))
  sylan(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0), w0), ∃(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0), w0), (ℤ≥ ` s0)≠ ∅)
  eleq2s(s0, c0, (ℤ≥ ` c1), (ℤ≥ ` s0)≠ ∅)
  3syl(s0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` c1), (ℤ≥ ` s0)≠ ∅, s0 ∈ ℤ, s0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0))
  eluzelz(s0, c1)
  uzid(s0)
  ne0i(s0, (ℤ≥ ` s0))
  r19.2z(s1, (ℤ≥ ` s0), w0)
  imp(s0 ∈ c0, ∃(s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0), w0), ∃(s1 ∈ c0, w0))
  reximdv2(s1, (ℤ≥ ` s0), c0, s0 ∈ c0, w0, w0)
  anim1d(s0 ∈ c0, s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0), w0, s1 ∈ c0)
  ex(s0 ∈ c0, s1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s0), s1 ∈ c0)
  uztrn2(s0, c0, s1, c1)
  diff.wrex.s(s0, s1, c0, w0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cuz, s0)
  diff.cuz.s(s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, s0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: rexuzre
blocks.content: Convert an upper real quantifier to an upper integer quantifier. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm rexuzre(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cz), wb(wrex(s0, c1, wral(s1, cfv(cuz, cv(s0)), w0)), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c1, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), w0)))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cuz, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

blocks.name: rexico
blocks.content: Restrict the base of an upper real quantifier to an upper real set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm rexico(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(wss(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wb(wrex(s0, co(c1, cico, cpnf), wral(s1, c0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), w0))), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), w0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

  -| diffsc(s1, c0)

} = {
  impbid(wa(wss(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wrex(s0, co(c1, cico, cpnf), wral(s1, c0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), w0))), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), w0))))

  pnfxr()

  syl6ib(wa(wss(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), w0))), wrex(s0, co(c1, cico, cpnf), wral(s1, c0, wi(wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1)), w0))), wrex(hs0, co(c1, cico, cpnf), wral(s1, c0, wi(wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cv(s1)), w0))))

  simpr(wa(wss(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wcel(cv(s0), cr))
  simplr(wss(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(cv(s0), cr))

blocks.name: sqreulem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ sqreu : write a general complex square root in terms of the square root function over nonnegative reals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jul-2013.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: sqreu
blocks.content: Existence and uniqueness for the square root function in general. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jul-2013.)
blocks.origin:

thm sqrtthlem(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℂ →(((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re `(sqrt ` c0))∧(i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+))
} = {
  mpbird(c0 ∈ ℂ, (((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re `(sqrt ` c0))∧(i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+), iota(hs0 ∈ ℂ,((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+))=(sqrt ` c0))
  eqcomd(iota(hs0 ∈ ℂ,((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+)), (sqrt ` c0), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  sqrtval(hs0, c0)
  syl2anc(c0 ∈ ℂ, ((((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re `(sqrt ` c0))∧(i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+)↔ iota(hs0 ∈ ℂ,((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+))=(sqrt ` c0)), (sqrt ` c0)∈ ℂ, ∃!(hs0 ∈ ℂ,((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+)))
  sqrtcl(c0)
  sqreu(hs0, c0)
  riota2(hs0, (sqrt ` c0), cc, ((hs0[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs0)∧(i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+), (((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0 ∧ 0[≤](Re `(sqrt ` c0))∧(i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+))
  3anbi123d(hs0 =(sqrt ` c0), (hs0[^]2)= c0, 0[≤](Re ` hs0), (i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+, ((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0, 0[≤](Re `(sqrt ` c0)), (i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+)
  eqeq1d((hs0[^]2), c0, ((sqrt ` c0)[^]2), hs0 =(sqrt ` c0))
  oveq1(hs0, (sqrt ` c0), cexp, nat2)
  breq2d(nat0, cle, (Re ` hs0), (Re `(sqrt ` c0)), hs0 =(sqrt ` c0))
  fveq2(hs0, (sqrt ` c0), cre)
  syl(hs0 =(sqrt ` c0), ((i[×]hs0)∉ ℝ+ ↔(i[×](sqrt ` c0))∉ ℝ+), (i[×]hs0)=(i[×](sqrt ` c0)))
  oveq2(hs0, (sqrt ` c0), ci, cmul)
  neleq1((i[×]hs0), (i[×](sqrt ` c0)), crp)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c((sqrt ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cc)

}

blocks.content: Mapping domain and codomain of the square root function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm sqrtf() {
  |- wf(csqrt, cc, cc)
} = {
  mpbir2an(wf(csqrt, cc, cc), wfn(csqrt, cc), wral(hs0, cc, wcel(cfv(csqrt, cv(hs0)), cc)))
  fnmpti(hs0, csqrt, cc, crio(hs1, cc, w3a(wceq(co(cv(hs1), cexp, nat2), cv(hs0)), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(hs1))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(hs1)), crp))))
  riotaex(hs1, cc, w3a(wceq(co(cv(hs1), cexp, nat2), cv(hs0)), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, cv(hs1))), wnel(co(ci, cmul, cv(hs1)), crp)))
  df-sqrt(hs0, hs1)
  rgen(hs0, cc, wcel(cfv(csqrt, cv(hs0)), cc))
  sqrtcl(cv(hs0))
  ffnfv(hs0, csqrt, cc, cc)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(csqrt)
}

thm sqrtf() {
  ⊢ (sqrt : ℂ → ℂ)
} = {
  mpbir2an((sqrt : ℂ → ℂ), sqrt[Fn]ℂ, ∀(hs0 ∈ ℂ,(sqrt ` hs0)∈ ℂ))
  fnmpti(hs0, csqrt, cc, iota(hs1 ∈ ℂ,((hs1[^]2)= hs0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs1)∧(i[×]hs1)∉ ℝ+)))
  riotaex(hs1, cc, ((hs1[^]2)= hs0 ∧ 0[≤](Re ` hs1)∧(i[×]hs1)∉ ℝ+))
  df-sqrt(hs0, hs1)
  rgen(hs0, cc, (sqrt ` hs0)∈ ℂ)
  sqrtcl(hs0)
  ffnfv(hs0, csqrt, cc, cc)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)

blocks.name: sqrtth
blocks.content: Square root theorem over the complex numbers. Theorem I.35 of [Apostol] p. 29. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jul-2013.)

blocks.name: sqrtrege0
blocks.content: The square root function must make a choice between the two roots, which differ by a sign change. In the general complex case, the choice of "positive" and "negative" is not so clear. The convention we use is to take the root with positive real part, unless ` A ` is a nonpositive real (in which case both roots have 0 real part); in this case we take the one in the positive imaginary direction. Another way to look at this is that we choose the root that is largest with respect to lexicographic order on the complex numbers (sorting by real part first, then by imaginary part as tie-breaker). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jul-2013.)

blocks.name: eqsqrt2d
blocks.content: A deduction for showing that a number equals the square root of another. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm eqsqrt2d(class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, cfv(csqrt, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cc))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, cexp, nat2), c1))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(nat0, clt, cfv(cre, c0)))
} = {
  eqsqrtd(c0, c1, w0)
  mpd(w0, wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, c0)), wbr(nat0, clt, cfv(cre, c0)))
  sylancr(w0, wi(wbr(nat0, clt, cfv(cre, c0)), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cre, c0))), wcel(nat0, cr), wcel(cfv(cre, c0), cr))
  0re()
  recld(c0, w0)
  ltle(nat0, cfv(cre, c0))
  syl(w0, wn(wcel(co(ci, cmul, c0), crp)), wne(cfv(cim, co(ci, cmul, c0)), nat0))
  eqnetrrd(cfv(cim, co(ci, cmul, c0)), nat0, cfv(cre, c0), w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(cfv(cre, c0), cfv(cim, co(ci, cmul, c0))), wcel(c0, cc))
  reim(c0)
  gt0ne0d(cfv(cre, c0), w0)
  necon3ai(cfv(cim, co(ci, cmul, c0)), nat0, wcel(co(ci, cmul, c0), crp))
  reim0d(co(ci, cmul, c0), wcel(co(ci, cmul, c0), crp))
  rpre(co(ci, cmul, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm eqsqrt2d(class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 =(sqrt ` c1))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ ℂ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ ℂ)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0[^]2)= c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → 0[<](Re ` c0))
} = {
  eqsqrtd(c0, c1, w0)
  mpd(w0, 0[≤](Re ` c0), 0[<](Re ` c0))
  sylancr(w0, (0[<](Re ` c0)→ 0[≤](Re ` c0)), 0 ∈ ℝ, (Re ` c0)∈ ℝ)
  0re()
  recld(c0, w0)
  ltle(nat0, (Re ` c0))
  syl(w0, ¬(i[×]c0)∈ ℝ+, (Im `(i[×]c0))≠ 0)
  eqnetrrd((Im `(i[×]c0)), nat0, (Re ` c0), w0)
  syl(w0, (Re ` c0)=(Im `(i[×]c0)), c0 ∈ ℂ)
  reim(c0)
  gt0ne0d((Re ` c0), w0)
  necon3ai((Im `(i[×]c0)), nat0, (i[×]c0)∈ ℝ+)
  reim0d((i[×]c0), (i[×]c0)∈ ℝ+)
  rpre((i[×]c0))
}

blocks.name: cnsqrt00
blocks.content: A square root of a complex number is zero iff its argument is 0. Version of ~ sqrt00 for complex numbers. (Contributed by AV, 26-Jan-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnsqrt00(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wb(wceq(cfv(csqrt, c0), nat0), wceq(c0, nat0)))
} = {
  impbid1(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(csqrt, c0), nat0), wceq(c0, nat0))
  syl5ib(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(csqrt, c0), nat0), wceq(c0, nat0), wceq(co(cfv(csqrt, c0), cexp, nat2), co(nat0, cexp, nat2)))
  oveq1(cfv(csqrt, c0), nat0, cexp, nat2)
  eqeq12d(co(cfv(csqrt, c0), cexp, nat2), co(nat0, cexp, nat2), c0, nat0, wcel(c0, cc))
  sqrtth(c0)
  a1i(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(co(nat0, cexp, nat2), nat0))
  sq0()
  syl6eq(cfv(csqrt, c0), nat0, cfv(csqrt, nat0), wceq(c0, nat0))
  fveq2(c0, nat0, csqrt)
  sqrt0()
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cnsqrt00(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℂ →((sqrt ` c0)= 0 ↔ c0 = 0))
} = {
  impbid1(c0 ∈ ℂ, (sqrt ` c0)= 0, c0 = 0)
  syl5ib(c0 ∈ ℂ, (sqrt ` c0)= 0, c0 = 0, ((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)=(0[^]2))
  oveq1((sqrt ` c0), nat0, cexp, nat2)
  eqeq12d(((sqrt ` c0)[^]2), (0[^]2), c0, nat0, c0 ∈ ℂ)
  sqrtth(c0)
  a1i(c0 ∈ ℂ, (0[^]2)= 0)
  sq0()
  syl6eq((sqrt ` c0), nat0, (sqrt ` 0), c0 = 0)
  fveq2(c0, nat0, csqrt)
  sqrt0()
}

blocks.name: releabsi

blocks.name: abscld
blocks.content: Real closure of absolute value. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: sqrtcld
blocks.content: Closure of the square root function over the complex numbers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: sqrtrege0d
blocks.content: The real part of the square root function is nonnegative. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: sqsqrtd
blocks.content: Square root theorem. Theorem I.35 of [Apostol] p. 29. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: msqsqrtd
blocks.content: Square root theorem. Theorem I.35 of [Apostol] p. 29. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: sqr00d
blocks.content: A square root is zero iff its argument is 0. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absvalsqd
blocks.content: Square of value of absolute value function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absvalsq2d
blocks.content: Square of value of absolute value function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absge0d
blocks.content: Absolute value is nonnegative. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absval2d
blocks.content: Value of absolute value function. Definition 10.36 of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: abs00d
blocks.content: The absolute value of a number is zero iff the number is zero. Proposition 10-3.7(c) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absne0d
blocks.content: The absolute value of a number is zero iff the number is zero. Proposition 10-3.7(c) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absrpcld
blocks.content: The absolute value of a nonzero number is a positive real. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absnegd
blocks.content: Absolute value of negative. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: abscjd
blocks.content: The absolute value of a number and its conjugate are the same. Proposition 10-3.7(b) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: releabsd
blocks.content: The real part of a number is less than or equal to its absolute value. Proposition 10-3.7(d) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absexpd
blocks.content: Absolute value of positive integer exponentiation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: abssubd
blocks.content: Swapping order of subtraction doesn't change the absolute value. Example of [Apostol] p. 363. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absmuld
blocks.content: Absolute value distributes over multiplication. Proposition 10-3.7(f) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: absdivd
blocks.content: Absolute value distributes over division. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: abstrid
blocks.content: Triangle inequality for absolute value. Proposition 10-3.7(h) of [Gleason] p. 133. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: abs2difd
blocks.content: Difference of absolute values. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: abs2dif2d
blocks.content: Difference of absolute values. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: abs2difabsd
blocks.content: Absolute value of difference of absolute values. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: abs3difd
blocks.content: Absolute value of differences around common element. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: abs3lemd
blocks.content: Lemma involving absolute value of differences. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2016.)

blocks.name: reusq0
blocks.content: A complex number is the square of exactly one complex number iff the given complex number is zero. (Contributed by AV, 21-Jun-2023.)

blocks.name: bhmafibid1cn
blocks.content: The Brahmagupta-Fibonacci identity for complex numbers. Express the product of two sums of two squares as a sum of two squares. First result. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 1-Feb-2020.) Generalization for complex numbers proposed by GL. (Revised by AV, 8-Jun-2023.)

blocks.name: bhmafibid2cn
blocks.content: The Brahmagupta-Fibonacci identity for complex numbers. Express the product of two sums of two squares as a sum of two squares. Second result. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 1-Feb-2020.) Generalization for complex numbers proposed by GL. (Revised by AV, 8-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: bhmafibid1
blocks.content: The Brahmagupta-Fibonacci identity. Express the product of two sums of two squares as a sum of two squares. First result. Remark: The proof uses a different approach than the proof of ~ bhmafibid1cn , and is a little bit shorter. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 1-Feb-2020.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm bhmafibid1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wa(wcel(c2, cr), wcel(c3, cr))), wceq(co(co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c1, cexp, nat2)), cmul, co(co(c2, cexp, nat2), caddc, co(c3, cexp, nat2))), co(co(co(co(c0, cmul, c2), cmin, co(c1, cmul, c3)), cexp, nat2), caddc, co(co(co(c0, cmul, c3), caddc, co(c1, cmul, c2)), cexp, nat2))))

blocks.name: bhmafibid2
blocks.content: The Brahmagupta-Fibonacci identity. Express the product of two sums of two squares as a sum of two squares. Second result. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 1-Feb-2020.)
